item.title: About
item.description: I’m currently a machine learning geoscience researcher and technical & business development in Asia Pacific Region at dGB Earth Science based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. My role includes building and shipping machine learning models to solve geoscience problems, implement business development strategies, conduct market research, also develop and maintain relationships with universities in the Asia Pacific Region. In January 2023, I graduated from Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS with an MSc by research in Petroleum Geoscience.

item.title: Automated Geological Features Detection in 3D Seismic Data Using Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Applied Science MDPI Abstract A geological interpretation plays an important role to gain information about the structural and stratigraphic of hydrocarbon reservoirs. However, this is a time-consuming task due to the complexity and size of seismic data. We propose a semi-supervised learning technique to automatically and accurately delineate the geological features from 3D seismic data. To generate labeling data for training the supervised Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model, we propose an efficient workflow based on unsupervised learning.

item.title: Geological Features Estimation with Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Automated geological interpretation in 3D seismic data using enhanced workflow combine multi attribute seismic, unsupervised machine learning, and Convolutional Neural Network

item.title: How to master Streamlit for Data Science
item.description: Preview The essential Streamlit for all your data science needs To build a web app you’d typically use such Python web frameworks as Django and Flask. But the steep learning curve and the big time investment for implementing these apps present a major hurdle. Streamlit makes the app creation process as simple as writing Python scripts! In this article, you’ll learn how to master Streamlit when getting started with data science.

item.title: What Is Bioinformatics
item.description: Introduction So you probably have heard of the term Bioinformatics before, but did not get the chance to learn more about what it is and what it can do. In this article, I will be giving you a brief high-level overview of this exciting field of Bioinformatics. Thus, the article will be comprehensible to those coming from biology or computer backgrounds alike. As a biologist, I have self-taught myself data science and coding (R and Python) after several years of persistence (initially quitting a couple of times the coding concept just kind of clicked at some point in time).

item.title: Early Results of Comparison between K-Nearest Neighbor and Artificial Neural Network Method for Facies Estimation
item.description: Journal Geofisika Abstract Artificial Intelligence method has been widely used recently in many aspects to understand big data. Fundamentally, the purpose of Artificial Intelligence is to solve nonlinear problem. Most methods are trying to optimize an output from one or many inputs parameter by identifying any potential patterns that fit or using a statistical data. In Oil & Gas industry, one of the main challenges that can be solved by Artificial Intelligence is estimating facies from well log or seismic data.

item.title: Machine learning: Using optimized KNN (K-Nearest Neighbors) to predict the facies classifications
item.description: The 13th SEGJ International Symposium, Tokyo, Japan, 12-14 November 2018 Abstract Machine learning is getting more popularity nowadays since it has potential to improve the quality of our life in many fields through data learning and optimization. In a short explanation, machine learning can be seen as non-linear equation optimization that try to predict one output from several input parameters although it may not have any logical relationships. In the world of geoscience work, one challenging problem is lithology estimation from several logs input and/or seismic data.

item.title: Facies classification using Machine Learning
item.description: Find optimum model to classified lithofacies from well log parameter data
